result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: April 11 BFH Notices

Clerk: Amanda.
Case Called at 11:09 am.
INCLUDES: 21CF790 21CF796 22CF112 & 22CF144. 
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears, and by Attorney Chad Shamali. 

COURT questions Defendant re: missed appearance.

COURT QUASHES WARRANT & VACATES BOND FORFEITURE. 

COURT ORDERS: $5,000 signature bond, with the first $500 in cash (already posted), to cover all files, and with the same conditions. 

NEXT DATE: 
STC set for 5/31/22 at 11:45 am. 

Adj: 11:12 am.

$5000 Signature bond with the first $500 cash (already posted). Includes cases 22CF144, 22CF112, 21CF790 and 21CF796. - No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. No driving without a valid license. Prints and photograph. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

$5000 Signature bond with the first $500 cash (already posted). Includes cases 22CF144, 22CF112, 21CF790 and 21CF796. - No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents.
